content.title: Poompuhar State Award
content.department: Department of Handlooms, Handicrafts, Textiles & Khadi
content.details: The 'Poompuhar State Award' scheme was launched by the Department of Handlooms, Handicrafts, Textiles & Khadi, Government of Tamil Nadu. The best artisans who have contributed to the development of the crafts of Tamil Nadu are selected and given a cash prize of ₹50,000/, a 4-gram gold medal, tamirapathiram and a certificate. The economically backward awardees are also eligible for a monthly pension of ₹3,500/- after completion of 60 years of age.
benefits: Monthly Pension of ₹3,500/- to the economically backward awardee
eligibility: The applicant should be an artisan
The applicant should be a native of Tamil Nadu
The applicant should be above 30 years of age. For monthly pension, the applicant should be 60 years or above in age
The experience of the artisans and the service rendered by them in their profession will be taken into consideration during the passing
exclusions: An artisan who has already won the Poombukar State Award cannot participate again
content.application_process: Offline. The interested applicant should take print of the prescribed format of the application form, fill in all mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph, and attach copies of all mandatory documents. Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Poombukar Head Office Tamil Nadu Handicrafts Development Corporation.
documents_required: Artisan's Affidavit on ₹20/- Stamp Paper, attested by a First Class Criminal Judge or Notary Public

Recommendation Certificate, attested by any of the Managers of Poombucar Outlets and Manufacturing Plants / the respective Area Assistant Directors (Handicrafts / Craft Council (Tamil Nadu/India/World)
Photograph of the applicant at each stage of production of the product for the award/Video

faqs.question: What is the purpose of the Poompuhar State Award?
faqs.answer: The purpose of the Poompuhar State Award is to recognize and honor craftspersons who have made significant contributions to the development of Tamil Nadu's crafts.

faqs.question: What are the rewards for the Poompuhar State Award winners?
faqs.answer: The rewards for the Poompuhar State Award include a cash prize of ₹50,000/-, a four-gram gold medal, Thamirapathiram, and a certificate of recognition.

faqs.question: Where can artisans apply for the Poompuhar State Award?
faqs.answer: Artisans can apply for the Poompuhar State Award through the Tamil Nadu Handicrafts Development Corporation.

faqs.question: How many artisans are selected for the Poompuhar State Award each year?
faqs.answer: Ten artisans are selected per year for the Poompuhar State Award.

faqs.question: What are the criteria for eligibility for the Poompuhar State Award?
faqs.answer: Eligibility for the Poompuhar State Award includes being above 30 years of age and from Tamil Nadu.

faqs.question: When should the production of the handicrafts for the award be completed?
faqs.answer: The production of handicrafts for the award should be completed within 30 days after the application deadline.

faqs.question: Who will inspect and record the production process for the award?
faqs.answer: Officers or managers of the company will inspect and record the production process for the award.

faqs.question: What evidence must be submitted along with the award material?
faqs.answer: Evidence, such as photographs and videos, must be submitted along with the award material.

faqs.question: What is the requirement regarding the affidavit for the award?
faqs.answer: An affidavit of the artisan on Rs. 20 stamp paper or attestation by a Notary Public is required for the award.

faqs.question: Who is responsible for any damage to the prize material during competition-related activities?
faqs.answer: The management is not liable for any damage to the prize material during competition-related activities, and no compensation will be provided.

faqs.question: Will the artisans be interviewed for the Poompuhar State Award?
faqs.answer: Artisans may be invited for an interview if required by the head office to check their ability to describe the recipe and craftsmanship.

faqs.question: What is the purpose of the interview, if required?
faqs.answer: The interview aims to assess the artisan's ability to describe the recipe and craftsmanship.

faqs.question: What is the address for submitting the completed application forms?
faqs.answer: The completed application forms should be submitted to the Head Office in Chennai.

faqs.question: How many days does the management accept submissions at the head office?
faqs.answer: Submissions for the award are accepted at the head office in Chennai during office days (Monday to Friday).

faqs.question: Will compensation be provided for any damage to the prize material?
faqs.answer: No compensation will be provided for any damage to the prize material caused by competition-related activities.
